required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Management of Lower Limb Apophysitis: A Cross-sectional Study on Long-term Impact on Health Status
clinical_study.official_title: Management of Lower Limb Apophysitis: A Cross-sectional Study on Long-term Impact on Health Status

brief_summary.textblock: Lower limb apophysitis cause long-term pain, decrease in function, and can reduce or completely hinder participation in sports and physical activity, yet there is little knowledge on the long-term consequences for health. Our objective with this investigation is to capture self-reported health-status for all adults having been diagnosed with lower limb apophysitis in the period of 1977 to 2020 and compared these data with normative values for the background population. We are therefore conducting a national cross-sectional study based on data from the Danish National Patient Registry. In this protocol we describe, as detailed as possible, the planned methods.

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-reported level of satisfaction with participation in physical activity and sports
secondary_outcome.description: Tegner activity scale (0-10, 10 being no physical activity) and individual specific specific questions
Evaluated on at 0-100 numerical pain rating scale pertaining (0 being no pain) to the knee or other body parts, and worst pain last week or the last month
Knee injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) and its 5 subscale each scoring 0-100, with 100 being the no problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Comorbidities from National Health Survey. and musculoskeletal diagnoses from knee or heel

clinical_study.condition: Lower Limb Apophysitis (Severs, Osgood Schlatter, Sinding-Larsen Johansson)

study_pop.textblock: Sample size will be of convenience with no pre-determined cut-off for smallest or largest sample of interest, rather, the final sample of respondents will be based on however many have been designated the diagnostic codes and responds to the survey.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients aged 18-55 having received diagnostics codes pertaining to lower limb apophysitis (Severs, Sinding-Larsen Johansson, Osgood Schlatter) in the years 1977-2020 in Denmark will be eligible to participate.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diseased participants will be censored

responsible_party.investigator_title: Clinical Research Coordinator, PhD-fellow, Physiotherapist, MSc

patient_data.ipd_description: The full dataset, excluding all personal identifiers, will be posted alongside the pre-print when the results have been disseminated.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: After primary publication and for the foreseeable futures thereafter.
